dc_title_s: Stanford's map of India : based on the surveys executed by order of the honourable the East India Company, special maps of the surveyor general and other authorities, showing the latest territorial acquisitions of the British Empire, and the independent and protected states, railways, canals, &c.
dc_description_s: Relief shown by hachures.; "Stanford's Geogl. Estabt., Charing Cross" in lower right corner.; Includes 4 insets: Distances and bearings from Bombay -- Distances and bearings from Madras -- Distances and bearings from Calcutta -- British Burma and the Straits settlements with the Indo-Chinese peninsula and the adjacent islands of the Malay archipelago.; Paper labels identifying "South" and "North" on one panel on verso of respective sheets.; Publisher's advertisements on one panel on verso of each sheet.|116 x 145 centimeters|Scale approximately 1:2,180,000|General Map Collection
